Section.Catchline: Florida or wild panther; killing prohibited; penalty.

Subsection.Text: It is unlawful for a person to kill a member of the Florida “endangered species,” as defined in s. 379.2291(3), known as the Florida panther (Felis concolor coryi).
It is unlawful for a person to kill any member of the species of panther (Felis concolor) occurring in the wild.

A person convicted of unlawfully killing a Florida panther, or unlawfully killing any member of the species of panther occurring in the wild, is guilty of a felony of the third degree, punishable as provided in s. 775.082, s. 775.083, or s. 775.084.
